JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;George Nicolaou;Lech Garlicki;Nebojša Vučinić;Päivi Hirvelä;Vincent A. De Gaetano;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: The applicant , Mr Spas Spasov Kaburov , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . The respondent Government are represented by PERSON , of ORG .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicant is the son of PERSON , who died on DATE . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , in TIME of CARDINAL DATE his father , PERSON , was stopped by a police officer in front of his house . The officer wanted to seize Mr Kaburov ’s car on suspicion that it had been stolen .

CARDINAL . Mr Kaburov refused to surrender the car , as the police officer did not present any seizure order or other relevant document . He got into the car and drove away , with the police chasing him .

CARDINAL . Shortly thereafter more police cars joined the chase . The policemen signalled PERSON to stop but he failed to do so . They fired shots at his car , shooting its tyres flat . PERSON got out of the car . Allegedly , after the police officers had caught him , they beat him , punching and kicking him , as a result of which he lost consciousness .

CARDINAL . According to the ORG , in the evening of CARDINAL DATE a police officer , acting with the consent of the district prosecutor , went to Mr ORG home to seize his car on suspicion that it had been imported and registered with false documents . He informed PERSON that the car was being seized and requested the registration documents and the keys of the car . Mr Kaburov refused to comply with the instructions , threatened the police officer and drove away in the car . The police officer called for help and started chasing PERSON . CARDINAL patrol cars joined the chase . The policemen shot the tyres of PERSON car flat and stopped it . Then PERSON Kaburov resisted the policemen and they had to use physical force and other means of restraint in order to arrest him , thereby causing him minor bodily harm . His car was seized .

CARDINAL . After the incident the policemen called an ambulance and Mr Kaburov was taken to the hospital in GPE , where he was examined by a doctor and the wounds on his head were stitched . He discharged himself from the hospital TIME .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON was examined by a forensic doctor , who found wounds on his forehead and nose , abrasions on his face and thighs and many bruises on his back . The doctor found that these injuries could have been inflicted at the time and in the way PERSON alleged and that the allegations that he had lost consciousness had to be proved by witnesses .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON went to the hospital in GPE , where he stayed for DATE , as it was established that he had broken ribs .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the police took written statements from the policemen who had been involved in the chase . The policemen , PERSON , PERSON PERSON , Mr PERSON , Mr T. and PERSON , stated that after PERSON tyres had been shot flat , he had got out of the car and had stumbled and fallen . He got up and cursed and threatened them . According to PERSON , his resistance lasted TIME , after which he was handcuffed and put in the patrol car .

CARDINAL . The road traffic policemen Mr S.B. and Mr NORP stated that they had been called after PERSON arrest and requested to test him for alcohol . However , when they arrived , PERSON condition did not permit the use of a breath alcohol test , and therefore a physician took a blood sample from him .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON lodged a criminal complaint with the military prosecutor . He enclosed written statements from CARDINAL individuals , PERSON , Mr PERSON and Mr GPE , who had allegedly observed his arrest from a nearby café . According to their statements , after PERSON tyres had been shot flat , he had got out of the car and was standing next to it . CARDINAL policemen had started beating him and kicking him . He had lost consciousness . Then the policemen had handcuffed him and put him into the police car .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the GPE regional military prosecutor refused to open criminal proceedings . He reasoned that PERSON car had been registered with false documents and that during the police check he had refused to comply with the policemen ’s orders and had tried to escape in his car . Therefore the policemen had shot at its tyres and subsequently had used physical force against him . He further stated that it had not been proved that the policemen had abused their power .

CARDINAL . On an appeal , on CARDINAL DATE the military appeals prosecutor quashed the refusal and remitted the case for further inquiry . He instructed the regional military prosecutor to question the policemen and Mr ORG wife .

CARDINAL . In a letter to the military appeals prosecutor of CARDINAL DATE Mr Kaburov insisted that the inquiry should not be carried out by the policemen ’s superiors , because they had an interest in the outcome of the case . He again requested that eyewitnesses PERSON , Mr PERSON and Mr S.T. be questioned and enclosed written statements from CARDINAL other individuals who had allegedly seen policemen shooting at PERSON car during the chase .
CARDINAL . On DATE the military appeals prosecutor forwarded Mr Kaburov ’s letter to the regional military prosecutor . There is no information as to whether the latter responded to his requests .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the regional military prosecutor questioned Mr ORG wife and CARDINAL policemen and took written statements from several other policemen . On DATE he again refused to open criminal proceedings , reasoning , without elaborating further , that he could not reach an unequivocal conclusion that the policemen had used excessive force against PERSON .
CARDINAL . In a letter to the regional military prosecutor ’s office in DATE PERSON requested that the prosecutor working on his case be replaced . It appears that his request was dismissed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the regional military prosecutor opened an investigation into PERSON allegations of ill - treatment .
CARDINAL . DATE the regional military prosecutor and the military investigator questioned CARDINAL witnesses .

CARDINAL . NORP The policeman PERSON confirmed his earlier statement that PERSON Kaburov had stumbled and fallen down while getting out of his car ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . He further stated that after PERSON had stood up , he had insulted and threatened the policemen . Then CARDINAL of the officers had knocked him over and PERSON had managed to handcuff him and put him into the car . PERSON also stated that the purpose of calling an ambulance was to carry out an alcohol test on PERSON .

CARDINAL . NORP The policeman PERSON stated that after PERSON car had been stopped , PERSON had attacked him and had shouted threats at him , after which they had grappled and fallen to the ground . Then another policeman had managed to handcuff PERSON . Other policemen had arrived and Mr Kaburov had been put into the police car .

CARDINAL . Eyewitnesses Mr M. and Mr S.T. stated that CARDINAL policeman had grabbed PERSON and another had hit him with his pistol . Then other policemen had kicked him . The witnesses stated that they would not be able to recognise the policemen .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON was killed . His widow and another individual were convicted of the murder .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the eyewitnesses PERSON and PERSON were questioned again . They confirmed their previous testimony .

CARDINAL . On DATE the military investigator suggested that the criminal proceedings be discontinued . He reasoned that it had not been established which officer had hit PERSON , and again concluded that it had not been unequivocally proved that the policemen had used excessive force against him . He further stated that after PERSON death it was no longer possible to hold a confrontation between him and the police officers .
CARDINAL . On DATE the regional military prosecutor terminated the criminal proceedings , giving similar reasoning .
CARDINAL . On DATE the military appeals prosecutor quashed the decision of DATE and remitted the case with instructions for a thorough investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the regional military prosecutor remitted the case to the investigator .

CARDINAL . On DATE eyewitness Mr S.T. was questioned again . He stated that he had previously been addicted to drugs but had undergone successful treatment . He further stated that on DATE Mr Kaburov had not resisted the policemen . He also stated that he was not sure if any of the policemen had hit PERSON .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator organised an identity parade at which eyewitnesses Mr M. and Mr H.P. could not identify any of the individuals presented as the policemen who had beaten PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE the military investigator suggested that the proceedings be terminated , finding that there was no indication of any unlawful conduct on the part of the policemen during PERSON arrest .

CARDINAL . On DATE the regional military prosecutor terminated the proceedings . He stated that PERSON had resisted the policemen and that therefore the use of physical force against him had been justified .
CARDINAL . On DATE the military appeals prosecutor upheld the decree of DATE with similar reasoning .

CARDINAL . In a final decision of DATE ORG upheld the decree of DATE . It reasoned that PERSON had resisted the policemen , which had prompted them to use “ physical force and other means of restraint ” against him , thereby inflicting wounds and bruises on his face , back and both thighs .

CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE district prosecutor opened an investigation in respect of PERSON , on suspicion that during the incident of DATE he had insulted a police officer and threatened him with murder , and had refused to comply with the orders of police officers . During the investigation she questioned the individuals who had participated in the events of CARDINAL DATE . Following PERSON death , she terminated the proceedings on DATE . In a final decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG upheld the termination .

CARDINAL . During the incident of CARDINAL DATE PERSON car was seized in connection with the alleged document fraud . It is not clear whether any proceedings were instituted against him . Eventually , on DATE the car was returned to him , as the prosecution authorities found that its seizure was no longer necessary for the purposes of the investigation . Apparently , it turned out that the car had not been stolen .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON brought an action against ORG and the prosecution authorities under the ORG and ORG . The applicant presented his version of the events of DATE and submitted medical certificates in support of his allegations that he had been beaten by police officers . He sought CARDINAL NORP levs ( ORG ) ( MONEY ( ORG ) ) in damages , stemming from the suffering , anguish and anxiety that he had undergone because of the shooting and the beating . He also claimed that the seizure of the car had been unlawful as the seizure procedure had been breached , and claimed initially ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL , later increased to ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( approximately ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) in pecuniary damages , stemming from the impossibility to use his car for the period of its seizure DATE and DATE .
CARDINAL . In the course of the proceedings , on DATE PERSON died . The applicant , then aged DATE and represented by his mother , intervened in the proceedings as his son .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG dismissed the claim . Relying on the documents gathered in the course of the criminal investigation against the police officers ( see paragraphs CARDINAL above ) and against PERSON ( see paragraph DATE above ) , on medical expert opinions and on witness statements , ORG established that in TIME DATE a police officer had visited Mr Kaburov ’s home to seize his car in connection with a police inquiry . Mr Kaburov had refused to surrender the car , had threatened to kill the police officer and had driven away . The police officer and CARDINAL patrol cars had started chasing PERSON . The policemen had shot the tyres of Mr Kaburov ’s car flat and had stopped it . ORG further established :
“ ORG arrest followed , [ he ] resisted the policemen and [ they ] had to use physical force and other means of restraint , whereby minor bodily harm was caused to Kaburov ... ”

CARDINAL . ORG noted that PERSON had wounds on the head , skin abrasions and bruises on the face , back and both thighs as well as a closed thoracic trauma . However , it found that it had not been proved that Mr Kaburov had experienced any pain or suffering as a result of those injuries . It also noted that the policemen had fired shots at his car because he had tried to escape , and concluded that the force used during his arrest had been necessary within the boundaries allowed by the relevant legislation . It further noted that the plaintiff had not proved that PERSON had been frightened by the shots .

CARDINAL . ORG held that the seizure of the car had been lawful . It also found that no damages were due , as the applicant had claimed compensation for lost rental income but had failed to prove that he would have rented out the car .
CARDINAL . On appeal , the judgment was upheld in a final judgment of ORG of DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicable provisions of LAW and the ORG and ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) concerning ill - treatment by the police are set out in the ORG ’s judgment in the case of ORG v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE .

Pursuant to section CARDINAL of the ORG , if the alleged victim dies , their right to compensation for pecuniary damage is inherited . However , the right to compensation for non - pecuniary damage is inherited only if such an action has been brought by the alleged victim before his or her death . In the latter case the heirs may intervene in the pending proceedings in the alleged victim ’s stead .
